lines.text: Don't you understand that it's wrong to shoot people?
In some occasions one is given a medal for doing so.
[first lines]
Magnum 357, the most famous handgun in the world.
lines.character: Older Man at the Shooting Track

lines.text: At least we know the motive?
We do?

[Siika is trying to tell a difficult riddle]
You are in a dark room with two boxes. In the first one you have 25 black socks and in the other one you have 25 white socks. How many socks you have to take from each of those boxes to be sure that you have at least one pair of the same colour in your hands.

[without thinking]
Three.
Make coffee!
I don't take orders from men. That's why I never got married.
Have someone ever even propose you?
[she slaps him on his balls]
Welcome to Tampere, Mr. President!

[they are looking at Mertanen who's leaving from the shooting track]
Strange fellow!
lines.character: Older Man at the Shooting Track

lines.text: You think he's gay?
lines.character: Younger Man at the Shooting Track

lines.text: Don't know. But hell of a shooter he is. He hits the bull's eye every time he fires his gun.
lines.character: Older Man at the Shooting Track

lines.text: Could you tell me about your daughter?
She was such a nice girl!
She was a whore!
Huhtanen, you take care of the lesbians.

[to Huhtanen]
Watch out your back.
Good looking woman.
But dead.
In any case, it was this book that saved your life.
Dianthuses, goddamit!
